alert.note: Alert for Thurston (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 10:52PM PST until March 02 at 11:04PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda affecting Thurston County. Newaukum River Near Chehalis affecting Lewis County. .Hydrologically significant rain came to an end Tuesday. Rain in the next couple of days will not result in any changes to the river levels. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 213.0 feet, the Skookumchuck River in Thurston County will flood several residential and business areas around Bucoda. Flood waters will cover many roads * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 214.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting at 11 pm Tuesday around 214.1 feet. The river will begin receding wednesday morning falling below flood stage Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 211.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Wednesday morning at 700 AM PST.
